page.title: 17PROPOSED BYPASS
page.content: Long awaited routes for{Batheaston and {Swainswick bypasses}published by the Department of Transport in June 1985.Proposals on view at Batheaston {R.C.Church}along with{questionnaire}on which public may express views. Plans show{dual carriageway}along Avon valley with 3 lane roads branching off to{A36}and{A46}roads Suggested routes involve either new{roundabout}at A4/A46 junction at{Lambridge}or one further east. {Objectives}of proposed schemes are:- 1.All north-south through traffic should use new crossing avoiding city. 2.Relief for Batheaston - traffic reduced in 2006 by one third. 3.New A46 -free traffic flow and uphill overtaking.In{Swainswick}flow will be roughly half of that today. 4 Up to{15,000}vehicles fewer per day on A4 London Road.
